009package Fourier_Shape_Descriptors;
010
011import java.awt.Polygon;
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013import java.util.List;
014
015import ij.ImagePlus;
016import ij.gui.Overlay;
017import ij.gui.Roi;
018import ij.gui.ShapeRoi;
019import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
020import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
022import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.fd.FourierDescriptor;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.fd.FourierDescriptorTrigonometric;
025import imagingbook.common.math.Complex;
026
027/**
028 * This plugin demonstrates the use of the trigonometric method for calculating
029 * Fourier descriptors. The input image is assumed to contain a ROI whose
030 * (polygon) vertices are used to calculate the Fourier descriptor, The actual
031 * image content is ignored, thus the image type is irrelevant. A partial
032 * reconstruction of the contour (with 100 sample points) is calculated from the
033 * Fourier descriptor 'fd'. Finally, a pair of invariant descriptors (contained
034 * in the array 'fdAB') is calculated.
035 * 
036 * TODO: Explain prerequisites!
037 * 
038 * @author WB
039 * @version 2020/04/01
040 */
041
042public class Fourier_Descriptor_IrregularSampling extends Fourier_Descriptor_RegularSampling { //implements PlugInFilter {
043                        
044        private ImagePlus img;
045
046        @Override
047        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus img) { 
048        this.img = img;
049                return DOES_8G + ROI_REQUIRED + NO_CHANGES;
050        }
051        
052        @Override
053        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
054                if (!runDialog()) 
055                        return;
056                
057                Roi anyRoi = img.getRoi();
058                
059                // create the Fourier descriptor for 'anyRoi' with Mp coefficient pairs:
060                int Mp = FourierDescriptorPairs;
061                Pnt2d[] V = toPointArray(anyRoi);
062                Complex[] samples = FourierDescriptor.toComplexArray(V);
063                
064                FourierDescriptor fd = FourierDescriptorTrigonometric.from(V, Mp);
065//              FourierDescriptor fd = new FourierDescriptorFromPolygon(V, Mp);
066
067                // reconstruct the corresponding shape with 100 contour points:
068                Complex[] R = fd.getShapeFull(ShapeReconstructionPoints);
069                
070                // create a pair of invariant descriptors (G^A, G^B):
071                FourierDescriptor[] fdAB = fd.makeInvariant();
072                FourierDescriptor fdA = fdAB[0];        // = G^A
073                FourierDescriptor fdB = fdAB[1];        // = G^B
074
075                // ----------------------------------------------------------------
076                // show various reconstructions (as a vector overlay)
077                // ----------------------------------------------------------------
078                
079                Overlay oly = new Overlay();
080                
081                if (DrawOriginalContour) {
082                        Roi roi = makeClosedPathShape(samples, 0.5, 0.5);
083//                      Roi roi = makeClosedPathShape(fd.getSamples(), 0.5, 0.5);
084                        roi.setStrokeColor(ContourColor);
085                        roi.setStrokeWidth(ContourStrokeWidth);
086                        oly.add(roi);
087                }
088                
089                if (DrawOriginalSamplePoints) {
090                        for (Complex c : samples) {     // fd.getSamples()
091                                ShapeRoi roi = makeCircleShape(c, SampleRadius, 0.5, 0.5);
092                                roi.setStrokeColor(SampleStrokeColor);
093                                roi.setStrokeWidth(SampleStrokeWidth);
094                                if (SampleFillColor != null) {
095                                        roi.setFillColor(SampleFillColor);
096                                }
097                                oly.add(roi);
098                        }
099                }
100                
101                if (DrawShapeCenter) {
102                        ShapeRoi roi = makeCrossShape(fd.getCoefficient(0), 2, 0.5, 0.5);
103                        roi.setStrokeColor(ReconstructionColor);
104                        roi.setStrokeWidth(ReconstructionStrokeWidth);
105                        oly.add(roi);
106                }
107        
108                if (DrawReconstruction) {
109                        ShapeRoi roi = makeClosedPathShape(R, 0.5, 0.5);
110                        roi.setStrokeColor(ReconstructionColor);
111                        roi.setStrokeWidth(ReconstructionStrokeWidth);
112                        oly.add(roi);
113                }
114                
115                if (DrawNormalizedShapes) {
116                        ShapeRoi roiA = makeClosedPathShape(fdA.getShapeFull(ShapeReconstructionPoints), 0.5, 0.5);
117                        roiA.setStrokeColor(CanonicalShapeAColor);
118                        roiA.setStrokeWidth(ReconstructionStrokeWidth);
119                        oly.add(roiA);
120                        ShapeRoi roiB = makeClosedPathShape(fdB.getShapeFull(ShapeReconstructionPoints), 0.5, 0.5);
121                        roiB.setStrokeColor(CanonicalShapeBColor);
122                        roiB.setStrokeWidth(ReconstructionStrokeWidth);
123                        oly.add(roiB);
124                }
125                
126                String title = img.getShortTitle() + "-Fourier-Descriptors";
127                ByteProcessor ip2 = (ByteProcessor) ip.duplicate();
128                ImagePlus im = new ImagePlus(title, ip2);       
129                if (ip2.isInvertedLut()) {
130                        ip2.invert();
131                        ip2.invertLut();
132                }
133                brighten(ip2, 220);
134                im.setOverlay(oly);
135                im.show();
136        }
137        
138        // helper methods ------------------------------------------------------
139        
140        private Pnt2d[] toPointArray(Roi roi) {
141                Polygon poly = roi.getPolygon();
142                int[] xp = poly.xpoints;
143                int[] yp = poly.ypoints;
144                // copy vertices for all non-zero-length polygon segments:
145                List<Pnt2d> points = new ArrayList<>(xp.length);
146                points.add(PntInt.from(xp[0], yp[0]));
147                int last = 0;
148                for (int i = 1; i < xp.length; i++) {
149                        if (xp[last] != xp[i] || yp[last] != yp[i]) {
150                                points.add(PntInt.from(xp[i], yp[i]));
151                                last = i;
152                        }
153                }
154                // remove last point if the closing segment has zero length:
155                if (xp[last] == xp[0] && yp[last] == yp[0]) {
156                        points.remove(last);
157                }
158                return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
159        }
160        
161}
